body.p: Paragraph 18 of the revised IFRS 3 establishes the principle that the identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed should be measured at their acquisition‑date fair values. The reasons for that principle and its application to contingencies and non‑controlling interests are discussed in paragraphs BC198–BC245, and the definition of fair value is discussed in paragraphs BC246–BC251. The revised standards provide guidance on determining the acquisition‑date fair value of particular types of assets acquired, which is discussed in paragraphs BC252–BC262. The exceptions to the measurement principle are discussed in paragraphs BC279–BC311.
